The limited pool of clinicians in Sierra Leone was severely affected by the outbreak as Ebola-related mortality among health workers was particularly high.
23 Prior to the epidemic, Sierra Leone ranked fifth from bottom among 193 countries in terms of numbers of physicians per head of population.
24 As discussed above, so as not to further weaken the wider health system, the research team committed not to recruit any healthcare workers employed in the government health system or involved in the Ebola response without the approval of the appropriate authorities.
